name: Omni Los Angeles at California Plaza

reviews.text: I don't have that much to add to all the deserved praise the Omni has received. We got a $125 weekend rate, which we considered a fine bargain, though $26 for parking was steep (the family couldn't agree to park on the street as some other people posting had done).
reviews.title: The Omni is Good

reviews.text: My wife and daughter enjoyed the pool very much and could actually swim in it, unlike so many hotel pools. I was able to walk from the hotel to both the Downtown Standard (for early morning coffee since it's open 24/7) and Little Tokyo (for dinner). The latter walk took us through a few blocks mostly comprised of parking lots, which my wife and daughter complained about mightily, but (on friday night) there were always at least some people around and no suggestion of danger. (We took a very short bus ride back).
reviews.title: Superb service!

reviews.text: We also walked to a very pleasant cafe/wine bar--open 7 days--at 4th & Main in the Old Bank renovation project. The Omni is also literally adjacent to the main part of the Museum of Contemporary Art (MOCA) as well as the other atractions folks mentioned.
reviews.title: Best service, great location.
Awesome hotel
reviews.text: The Omni is clean and quiet and smoothly functioning, almost unreal. We asked for a high floor, they got us onto the 13th, though it didn't quite get over the neighboring highrises (but kudos for having a 13th floor). Not a lot of character to the hotel perhaps, but very very nice.

Booked a 4 star hotel on hotwire and got the OMNI Hotel in the California Plaza (one of two 4* downtown LAX hotels - the other is Hilton Checkers which is excellent too) at a fantastically low rate of under $80/night for the weekend!!! But it turned out my reservation was accidentally booked for March (same days and dates as Feb). At check-in I had basically no reservation but the manager and front desk agent went out of their way to call hotwire and change the dates. Amazingly my reservation was switched with no problem and surcharge at all. The service rendered and received was without question above and beyond what I'd expected esp. with the discounted rate I'd booked the room.
reviews.title: Great service, excellent hotel
thumbs down
reviews.text: We were disappointed @ the Omni in LA. The room was not spacious. The housekeeping was lacking. My room was not cleaned until late afternoon. I was totally disgusted when I witnessed pool area being cleaned using the dirty pool water. The fitness area is okay but not inspiring. The television was not flat screen in our room. \Valet parking is $30 daily. On the plus side the staff was friendly and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights pre-cruise at the Omni. We really enjoyed our stay, the rooms were spacious and comfortable, the entrance and public rooms were beautiful, and the staff were friendly and accomodating. We didn't use the hotel's shuttle bus, but the area between the hotel and the subway could be a bit scary at night. We weren't sure about staying in Downtown LA, but public transport is brilliant and everywhere was really easy to get to. We didn't eat or drink at the hotel as we found both to be very expensive but there was a nice pizza/pasta place across the road which also sold great cocktails,
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay!

reviews.text: on business in LA for 6 days, great stay at the Hotel, facilities top notch, and excellent staff, great housekeeping. fitness centre and pool clean and handy. Piano bar at night was busy with good atmosphere. will definately return.
reviews.title: Awesome stay

reviews.text: Enjoyed five nights. Courteous and helpful staff, many useful amenities included in reasonable price (e.g. WiFi) as 'Select' guest. Quick check in and out. Car valet service was $30/night, which added up over a five-night stay, but was convenient and efficient. Comfortable bed, but room seemed a bit outdated. Downtown location is good for business, not so good for social ambience.
reviews.title: Decent business hotel, rooms adequate but a bit tired

reviews.text: We just spent three nights at the Omni. It is a great hotel, with spacious rooms and attentive service. The rooms are just a notch below luxury, but they are spotless. The location is very convenient to just about anything you want to do in L.A. The hotel is in the financial district, so there is not much within walking distance. But, L.A. is not a "walking" city. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay and would book the hotel again.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Omni!

reviews.text: I coordinated a small, one day meeting, with attendees from all over the country, at this hotel. The staff treated our small meeting like we were the most important people staying at the hotel, which was absolutely not true (especially since the NY Rangers were staying there that night, too, and meeting in the conference room right next to ours). The staff were amazing, super helpful and super friendly. The meeting rooms were great, with natural light and good acoustics. The food was good, too.
reviews.title: Best Place For A Meeting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My hotel room was fantastic! I was checked in upon arrival at 10AM. Turn down service was provided and I received a note and a tray of food from the hotel, thanking us for choosing to have our meeting there.
reviews.title: Didn't meet my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great for downtown. Right across the street is the Gehry designed Museum of Contemporary Art. The immediate outdoor area is a very peaceful and pleasant courtyard area with water features and restaurants.
reviews.title: Convenience and comfort merit return trip

reviews.text: It took us about 30 minutes via cab to get to West Hollywood for dinner one night. But, it was only about a 15 minute walk from the Omni to The Standard Downtown for a dated and expensive rooftop scene.
reviews.title: Impeccable service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I'm pretty sure the Omni is outside my price range as a private citizen, I truly hope my employer sends me down to LA again so I can stay here one more time. Great hotel!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Difficult Location.

reviews.text: The is the best of the LA hotels I have stayed in recently. The rooms are beautiful and clean and recently updated. The hotel seems to be a little quieter than some of the others in the area (in a good way) but still has the same amenities and feel. I would recommend, and will stay here again when visiting LA!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here with family for combination business / vacation. The rooms are large and the beds very comfortable. The front of desk staff are all very efficient and courteous. The pool / exercise center is clean and well-appointed. No hot tub or sauna, unfortunately, and the pool is outdoors so it can get cold and windy.
reviews.title: Quality 4-star with a few extra perks

reviews.text: The milk and cookies provided every evening was a great touch, and adds to the family-friendly appeal of the hotel. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants but relied heavily on a late-night convenience store with a wide array or prepared foods. Again, a family-friendly alternative.
reviews.title: Incredible experience!

reviews.text: The hotel provides a town car service for around downtown, which can be convenient especially since parking is insanely expensive and, like most of Los Angeles, you do need to drive to get anywhere.
reviews.title: Great location for Arts
Service Outstanding, Facilities at a 4-star level.
reviews.text: The hotel is right on top of MOCA and the Disney Concert Hall, which can have its drawbacks especially if a special event is booked (as it was when we were there, and the noise was deafening). Other nearby points of interest include Calle Alameda, an outdoor Mexican market, and Little Tokyo. The Staples Center is nearby as well.

The Omni hotel is definitely a standout hotel among the ones I've been too in LA. It's located right in downtown LA and the views from the room let you see all of it. Rooms are quite large and I feel like they are decorated like your own bedroom--not a standard, basic hotel room.
reviews.title: Handsome Hotel--Great food and location

reviews.text: There are two good restaurants, one is a little more luxurious, but both have really good food. There a huge pool outside with nice lounge chairs. Also, the fitness center is very nice and has a lot of machines. I'd say it's a great place for everyone, business travelers in particular. I took a video of my stay and it shows more of what I was talking about: http://www.tripfilms.com/Travel_Video-v64421-Los_Angeles-The_Omni_Hotel-Video.html
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay at the Omni!

likes.liked: — The beds, friendly staff, kid backpacks

reviews.text: We stayed at the Omni LA during our tromp through Southern Califronia. Los Angeles was our first stop and we were more than happy with our stay at the hotel. The staff was amazing. Our kids loved the little back backs they received. The backpacks were more of a hit then the actual gadgets inside. The beds were heaven. I could have slept all day. We didn't get to enjoy the pool as it rained our entire stay in LA, but I saw that they had one. The only thing that could have gone better was our room service. We came in late one evening and ordered some hamburgers. That's pretty much what we got, hamburgers on a bun, no lettuce, cheese or anything. All in all it was a great stay in LA.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
A Winner in every category
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel while attending a convention at the L.A. Conention Center. Service is wonderful - we asked for a few things and got them almost immediately. There will always be an attendant to open the door for you. It is not the best location for the LACC as it is a mile and a half away. Fortunately we had shuttle service. There is also not much shopping or restaurants nearby as it is in the business district. But you can walk several blocks and get to what you need. The rooms are nice and comfortable however I agree about the entry way being awkward. The main door and bathroom door just inside almost bump together. The closet is roomy, but has no light. If you put your suitcase in there on the rack, you'll have a hard time seeing your belongings. TV does need to be upgraded. There were only about 10 channels available. But, those are minor things to me. I would stay here again.

reviews.title: Very Nice, Would Stay Here Again
reviews.text: This hotel is truly outstanding in every aspect. We were in a party of 16 people attending a convention downtown, and everyone of us were happy with the hotel.

I write reviews because I use reviews to select the hotels I stay in. This is the first hotel where I give it an almost perfect rating; especially for the money. It's 5 star all the way on both service and comfort. There aren't many restaurants around the hotel (it's in a business district), so the food's a little pricey, but it's delicious and the service was great. In fact, the only suggestion I can give this hotel is to upgrade the toilet paper!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from a weekend stay at the Omni Los Angeles @ California Plaza....and I must say that I was hoping for the best, but was so pleasantly surprised that this hotel met all my expectations and surpassed them. I was traveling with 13 other ladies for a weekend get-away/shopping/relaxation trip and I was responsible for making the accommodations, so I was a little nervous and my hopes were that everyone would be comfortable. I am "very" particular about where I lay my head and I wanted to have the best for our getaway without breaking the bank. The Omni was magnificent, the service was grand, the rooms were beautiful with a neutral decor, marble baths with separate shower and bathtub, large closet space and larger than average room. The beds, well, let's just say that some of us wanted to stay just to sleep in the "heavenly" bed just one more time. The beds are big, fluffy with lots of pillows and ultra comfortable.
reviews.title: "Excellent Stay in an Excellent Hotel"

likes.liked: — The size of the Room and the Heavenly bed and Location

reviews.title: "Great Hotel, Nice location"
reviews.text: The room service was excellent and very timely. A few of us ate at the Noe Restaurant in the Hotel on the first night, granted it is "very" pricey, but you get what you pay for. The service was par excellent and the food was wonderful. The swimming pool is a little small and there is no jacuzzi...I did not get an opportunity to visit the Spa, but the prices were quite high. The next day some of us ate in the Cafe, which was very nice and the food had a really nice flare to it. The location was perfect for us as we planned to go shopping at the Garment District which was a few blocks away. There aren't many places open around the Hotel during the weekend, but right outside the door of the hotel, there is a Day Spa where some of us went and had manicures and pedicures and there is also a Starbuck's that stays open on the weekends. In the same area right outside the Hotel in a Plaza there is nightly entertainment, i.e. bands, etc. And of course, you have the Museums and Disney Concert Music Hall right near the Hotel that is also open on the weekend.

reviews.title: Loved It!!!
reviews.text: The Hotel is close to the freeways and Saturday evening some of us went to the Universal City Walk for dinner and fun, which was about 20 minutes away. The Hotel has a courtesy Town Car to take you and pick you up from anywhere within a 3 mile radius. The Valet was steep at $28/night, but there is no other place to park, oh well.....All in all, this is a great place to stay and the only place that I will stay when in downtown Los Angeles....I have stayied in downtown L.A. several times in the past and the other Hotels cannot hold a candle to the Omni....I have already booked another stay with them next month. My hat goes off to the Omni Hotel and Staff and a very much deserved "Thank You" for making our weekend so wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, great location and an excellent staff, and very attentive to guests needs..I remember when I checked in at night the night person Gary was trying to check-in another guest and at the same time answering a call ang doing some things at the same time and yet he manages to smile at us and greeted us warmly and making sure we are gonna be taken care of, very nice guy..he's a keeper
reviews.title: Brilliant stay!
Special weekend getaway
reviews.text: To celebrate my husbands Birthday we went round trip on Amtrak from Oceanside, CA. The Omni will pick you up at the Union Station complementary. The hotel is located in Down town Los Angeles with-in walking distance to all musical events in the Plaza area. During the summer there are free out door concerts in the Plaza. The Omni website offers special weekend rates and packages.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the Concierge Level and enjoyed complimentary drinks and appetizers in the evening. We ate dinner in the hotel at Noe Restaurant . This is a five star dinning experience. After dinner we enjoyed the concert. Then went back to the Concierge for additional desert and coffee.
reviews.title: Omni - OK!

reviews.text: Sunday morning we had a huge breakfast in the Concierge room, everything you could imagine. After breakfast we went for our downtown walk. To walk downtown Los Angeles on a Sunday morning is a wonderful exploring experience. The streets are empty, no noise, cool breeze and a great photo opportunity. We took photo's of the Museum of Modern Art, Disney Hall, Dorothy Chandler Pavilion, the Courthouse, etc.
reviews.title: good choice in downtown

likes.disliked: — nothing except that they tried to get moi & my bro to share a king size bed, eeewwwww!!

reviews.text: Upon departure we were fortunate enough to have Robert as our driver. The Omni has a real jewel with Robert as one of their drivers.
reviews.title: Wouldn't go back

reviews.text: Thanks Omni Los Angeles for a great weekend get-a-way!
reviews.title: Very impressed!

reviews.text: Decent hotel, however nothing stands out as exceptional. I was there for a business meeting so it met my needs for location. Bed was comfortable. I personally prefer more counter space in bathrooms & the sink had a crack in it. Gym had nice equipment, but all treadmills & eliptical machines were in use by a few minutes after 5am so seemed small for size of hotel. I liked that there was a little convenience store & a bunch of decent places to grab lunch within the block due to the business location. Hotel food was good. Since I'm not a regular at Omni hotels, didn't get the turn-down service -- saw the cart & looked like nice treats. Front desk was friendly & efficient.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for business meeting

reviews.text: We decided to spend our wedding anniversary at this hotel and were delighted with the experience. Everyone seemed every courteous and helpful. The kids were thrilled to receive their own Omni kids backpack filled with goodies. The room was adequate with a great view of the Water Court. We dined at the Noe and the Grand Cafe and received excellent services both times. The quality of food was way better than the normal "hotel food". The only imperfection would be the in-room TV not being updated to the flat panel one yet.
reviews.title: wonderful experience, will come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at hotel for 5 nights and throughly enjoyed our time. The staff were very courteous and professional, aswell as friendly. The check in was very easy and quick and they let us check in 2 hours early as we were very tired from travelling. Room was spacious and very clean. Bathroom was very good too. They have a town car that will drop you and pick you up as a courtesy within a 3 mile radius. The hotel is on the list of pick ups for most tour places. Has some fantastic food places around the hotel. Recommend it for business as it does have a very good conference area. Love it and will refer it to everyone. Do recommend getting onto the Omni website and signing up as a select guest, as it is free, to get free Wi-Fi and other services.
reviews.title: Upper class hotel worth the money

reviews.text: Had to stay there for a few days during a big fair at LACC, so value for money was definitely not good.
reviews.title: Average business-oriented hotel. Not a top choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very average hotel, not too bad but without any outstanding feature. Was upgraded, which was a nice gesture, so had access to the quite nice business lounge at the top of the hotel with a nice view.
reviews.title: Good location, great room

reviews.text: We stayed at the Omni for 2nights. The Location was great. Its in the downtown area close to chinatown, staples, shopping area and restaurants. The service was excellent, valet parking, checking in, room service, housekeeping etc. The flower arrangements in the lobby are so beautiful and refreshing. They also gave my son a bag of toys and goodies. The room is somewhat disappointing. It is small, the decor dated, room configuration is not done properly ( e.g. when you open the closet you cannot go to the bathroom or front door. Maybe its only our room but still this is an inconvenience) and the tub is really small. However the bed is comfortable. Over all it was a NICE stay and we will definitely come back to OMNI when we go again for a vacation in Los Angeles.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I recently attended a business conference at the Omni thus, stayed at the hotel for two nights. I booked on Expedia with a good rate about 3 months before my stay.
reviews.title: Not bad but, not great .... Middle of Road Hotel for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few days before arriving, I was checking the Omni website for WiFi access and learned there is a charge of $9.95/day. But, if you sign up for "Select Guest" which is free and create a profile with your likes/dislikes, you get WiFi access for free as well as 2 morning drinks (oj, v8, etc....) and a daily paper of your choice. Also, if you book with the hotel, you can check in "Online" as long as give at least a two hour notice you are coming. Since I booked on Expedia, I could not do this.
reviews.title: Great Hotel... but.......

reviews.text: On arrival, check in was quick. You can only valet park which is $26/night. I got my requested high floor corner room on the 15th floor with a decent view. The room itself is a bit dated. The carpet showed signs of wear with stains. "Build Up" was around the shower door. The bathtub had a layer of sediment (or dirt) in it but, since it was late at night and I knew I would not use it (I used the separate shower), I just put a note the next morning to inform the staff the bathtub was "dirty." The TV is standard tube TV with a good representation of channels including HBO. The honor bar was well stocked and is a traditonal "dorm fridge" which I like since you can put your own things in it if you want (I just hate the new wave of honor bars that use motion sensors so you can't move anything or put in your own stuff). The big plus was the bed. It was very comfortable and pillows large and soft.
reviews.title: Nice property for the weekend warrior

likes.disliked: — Check in could have gone better

reviews.text: On my first night, turndown service was not done. Turn down service was done for the second night. Each morning, I received two drinks and the LA Times left at my door which I specificed on the Select Guest door hanger.
reviews.title: Probably the nicest hotel in Downtown LA.
Nice Omni
reviews.text: Good Location, nice size room, clean.
Join the select guest to get the one time upgrade coupon and two free drink per night. Parking a little bit expensive $24 a day.
reviews.title: Great Place - Location (Enjoyable Stay)

reviews.text: The Omni in Los Angeles is nice. The valet service, check-in process, and taking bags to the room worked very well. We had a special deal where we had the room and buffet breakfast in the morning (excellent value.....lots of great things to eat as well as an omelet/egg/pancake bar.). We signed up for the OMNI membership and it was delightful. Juice and coffee (or tea/hot chocolate) delivered to your room in the morning. Turn down service at night.
reviews.title: What can i say? excellent

reviews.text: The bathroom was large -included both a tub and a shower and very nice marble; including sound system for the TV (no TV but you could listen to it.)
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: The bar area, Noe Restaurant, and Grand Cafe were all very nice (and nice service).
reviews.title: Very Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: I stayed here during Siggraph 2008 and enjoyed it. There is an outdoor pool which was really nice. It was outside the fitness center. I really enjoyed going in for a dip after a work out.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with pool

reviews.text: You can get free Internet access if you sign up to be a member of the Omni hotel guest program. That was definitely a bonus.
reviews.title: Loved The Omni

likes.liked: — service, cleanliness, views, great buffet breakfast, great buffet lunch

reviews.text: I had a room on the 16th floor with a King sized bed. It was very comfortable and quiet. Nice views from the windows and a comfortable visit all around.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, friendly service, great location, nice food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved being here. This is a 4 star hotel, and it was a great experience. Everyone was very accomodating.
reviews.title: Average - Wouldn't stay again

reviews.text: Our first room had a view of the fountain - unfortunately in the afternoon I smelled cigarette smoke coming up through the air vents - it was not in the hallway, so it was not neighbors.
reviews.title: Nice Downtown Hotel

likes.liked: — Rooms and view of Disney Center

reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Omni.
reviews.title: Great location for down town

reviews.text: Great business class/style hotel and great location for down town being next door to Museum of Contemporary Art and across street from Disney Concert Hall.
reviews.title: I'm definitely going back
Mixed feelings
reviews.text: Valet parking at $24 per day seems to be only viable option as couple of lots we tried suggested not leaving our vehichle overnight as not manned 24 hours. (Pershing Sq appears to be a congregating point for homeless people close by at night).

reviews.title: Eat before you go!
reviews.text: We arrived at the Omni at California Plaza and were impressed. It's a really nice looking hotel and the concierge quickly offered to bring our luggage up to our rooms. For four women, you know we didn't pack light. Excellent guest service. Check in was quick for Halloween weekend. Our room was nice and clean, the size was enough for two girls and all of our stuff. The shower pressure was great, comparable to a waterfall. There is a built in speaker in the bathroom so that you can hear the television. I slept well in the comfortable bed. The cleaning ladies came while I was still asleep and did not stop knocking until I opened the door, that was probably the only negative thing. Yes, the room food is expensive. So it's up to you. There weren't any rowdy guests and that's always a plus. Our first day there, we parked in a lot on the corner behind the hotel since it was cheaper, but ended up walking for about 10 minutes dragging our luggage around downtown. So I suggest using Valet, it's more convenient. I would stay here again because it's a quiet area not far from shopping and nightlife, and the guest service is excellent.

reviews.title: A little expensive but great !
reviews.text: Stayed there over a long weekend (Nov 10-13) Was attending a convention at the Convention Center, which is in an absolutely dismal part of downtown, there are only terrible hotels within walking distance ( hotel figueroa, holiday inn) The omni is roughly a mile and a quarter away, but not a bad walk. It really tries to be a first class hotel in terms of services but it fallsa bit short. Example: we asked the concierge about local restaurants, they reccommmended in alvarado by the train station in a touristy area. Ok , the food was terrible and it was a rip off, but thats not why i was pissed. They provided us with a free town car ride to the place, but when we called back, they told us it would be at least 45 minutes to pick us up. I would still of not been mad , except it is very difficult to find cabs in LA, we had to walk over to the train station and only out of providence was there one there. They did apologize and reimbursed us for the cab. I guess my beef is that they should of warned us they might not be able to pick us up instead of putting us in a dangerous situation, and i would of gone to a more touristy area ( chinatown) where they have more cabs. Otherwise the hotel was fine. I guess my real beef is with LA, its just not tourist friendly at all, its too spread out and you definitely need a car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay here in september 2010. We thought it was really nice and it's very close to the 'underground' station so travelling around LA was really easy. We went to Hollywood, Univesal Studio's and Long Beach on the underground and we felt safe though some of the charaters there were quite unusual.
reviews.title: Very posh! hehe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is suited to business types but we did enjioy it. There is a nice bar behind the hotel whcih serve the BEST nachos we've had EVER had and is full people having after work drinks who loved the fact we had English accents and were very friendly.
reviews.title: Beautifully newly renovated

reviews.text: Beautifully newly renovated hotel. A great home away from home in downtown Los Angeles. The king bed was so comfortable and the furnishings were beautiful. The hotel restaurant is great too!
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Downtown Los Angeles

reviews.text: I have been travelling to Los Angeles for about 35 years. In the past, any level-headed visitor would avoid downtown Los Angeles at any cost. With the building of LA Live! this has changed. Downtown LA has come to life, with people on the street after dark, interesting restaurants, well-preserved architecture and the very convenient subway.
reviews.title: Toothpaste - The Little Touches That Separate the Great from the Good

reviews.text: The Omni is smack in the middle of all that is interesting in downtown LA...it is definitely the best value for money available anywhere in the greater LA area. The hotel is beautifully fitted, the staff and service excellent and the room comfortable.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel in Downtown LA

reviews.text: Room was nice and clean but did not get the turn down service and requests for breakfast juices was never picked up so we did not get that either. Front desk was sorry and did not charge for valet which by the way was $24 per day. Might look else where next time for better service.
reviews.title: Nice room romm service was bad

reviews.text: The Omni Hotel was a lovely, clean friendly place, and a good nightly rate. I cannot find fault with the hotel at all, the only thing me and my family did'nt like was downtown Los Angeles, its boring, especially at night its dead!
reviews.title: Loved the Omni!

reviews.text: We stayed for three nights,my daughter, husband and myself.We found the room comfortable and as members of The Omni Select guest program,we received complimentary morning beverages which was a great touch.The hotel was convenient for the Metro which we used to get to Universal.We were aware of the parking charge before check in and allied to the great rate we paid for the hotel it was still good value .
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

likes.disliked: — No changing facilities at the pool,gym area.

reviews.text: We did all the touristy things as this was our first visit to L.A. and really enjoyed The Warner Brothers Tour.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.disliked: — Waiting at check-in for a room and for valet to bring round my car

reviews.text: We arrived earlier than check-in time and our room was not ready. So, we waited till check-in time and it still was not ready. Front Desk then gave us an upgrade to the Executive Suite - 1 King bed and 1 sleeper sofa, huge bathroom, desk and chairs.
reviews.title: Superior Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel was a real find. Beautiful, yet not stuffy. Good first impression from the doormen to the front desk personnel..very warm and welcoming. Our room was lovely, but a little noisy from outside traffic. I called the front desk and was immediately upgraded to a Club Level room on the 16th floor. I had one minor problem in the room, and it was taken care of with appologies and a smile in record time. The Grand Cafe had wonderful yummy food and great service. We had an awesome lunch there (try the chicken burger). We were on business/pleasure and had a party to attend at the Standard Hotel...we were treated to a ride in the hotel complimentary towne car...now that's service. FYI...very happy to be at the Omni rather than the Standard.
reviews.title: Fabulous Customer Service...comfy sleep :0)

reviews.text: Thank you Omni for a great stay. We will be back.
reviews.title: A Very Pleasant Surprise!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights on business, March 5 – 8. As Marriott Platinum Rewards members, we always try to stay at a Marriott, but we couldn’t get a room anywhere downtown, and grudgingly stayed at the Omni instead. Wow! What a pleasant surprise this was. Although we are not members and haven’t stayed at an Omni in over 20 years, all of the staff, from the front door all the way up to the Concierge Lounge, treated us as old friends. The service at this hotel is absolutely top-flight. The Concierge Lounge at this Omni is truly “concierge” style. Unlike at the Marriott, alcoholic drinks are complimentary, mixed for you, and served to you at your table. In the evening, the Concierge Lounge staff always offers to make dinner reservations for you and to help in any way they can.
reviews.title: Best service; excellent follow-through

reviews.text: The hotel had a very nice bar area on the 3rd floor. We found the restaurant Noé to be highly overrated, but it was slightly better than most hotel restaurants.
reviews.title: Lakers Game

reviews.text: Our room (1724 Club Room) was tastefully decorated in warm shades of beige, taupe, gray, & charcoal. Although the bed was very comfortable, it was too high for me (5’2”) to easily get in & out of. We appreciated the extremely light duvet, which enabled us to sleep comfortably. There is a thicker duvet draped across the bottom of the bed if you need it. Lighting was excellent & bright. There was a large desk with comfortable leather chair, and an armchair with ottoman. The view was over Olive Street at the front entrance of the hotel. The bathroom was large enough in which to comfortably move around and had separate shower stall & bathtub. In addition to the usual shampoo, shower gel, conditioner, lotion and soap, there were also Q-tips, cotton balls, sewing kit, toothpaste, mouthwash, razor, shaving cream, shoe mitt & shower cap. The bar of soap was much larger than normally found in a hotel, which we very much appreciated.
reviews.title: Very luxurierst Hotel in downtown of LA
Loved the Omni!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Omni for 2 nights while on a business trip. Prices were obviously high, as expected for this hotel, but service was definitely up to par. Very friendly and helpful hotel staff.

No complaints about anything at all. Food was great at both restaurants -- Noe (creme brulee is awesome!) and the Grand Cafe (french toast is wonderful!). Didn't use the gym facility, but it looked good. My room overlooked the pool and it was situated on a rooftop and looked nice (just too cold out to swim). The room was excellent. Very clean and beautiful bed. Nice bathrobes available to use as well. I did request a single king bed (my preference), but they only had 2 queens when I checked in. Not a major issue, but I did check in at 8am (regular check-in is 3pm I believe), so they were pretty accomodating.
reviews.title: Stayed Here for a Dodger game

likes.disliked: — Not much to do within walking Distance

reviews.text: I highly recommend signing up for the Select Guest program that the Omni has (free to sign up on website). You get free internet access in your room (otherwise there is a charge) as well as your choice of newspaper in the mornings as well as 2 complimentary beverages each morning. A really great program for no charge, in my opinion. In addition, make sure to provide your mileage program number upon check-in so you earn mileage points for your stay.
reviews.title: Los Angeles Downtown location

likes.liked: — location and luxurious appointments of hotel

reviews.text: The location is okay for downtown access. It's connected to the California Plaza, so if you need to get to the Deloitte & Touche or KPMG bldgs, etc....this is the place to stay. Definitely easy access.
reviews.title: We were impressed with the Omni

likes.liked: — comfort of beds and courteous staff

reviews.title: Nice hotel but a bad experience with valet parking.
reviews.text: We booked this hotel to go to a Dodger game and were VERY happy. Cab was less than 20 and the Dodgers won the game! We were there on the weekend and the little mall nearby was closed and there was not a lot to do within walking distance. We felt very safe walking at night. there was a mini concert at the nearby mall. the pool was awesome. Room service was a little pricey but overall we were very pleased. We would stay there again.

This hotel's best service is undoubtedly its valet parking. The service is amazing. I never waited more than a minute or two for my car. In fact, there are some rates that include unlimited valet parking in it; however, be careful. I paid the higher rate to include this amenity and was charged for the parking anyway. The readily amended it when I brought it to their attention. (Maybe they're accustomed to having to do so.)
reviews.title: Nice hotel; I hope the area catches up with it

reviews.text: The area surrounding the hotel is very dicey. So, the hotel offers a free service in which they will take you or pick you up from any location within a three-mile radius until 11:00 p.m. This can be especially helpful since the streets are quite confusing with lots of one-way streets.
reviews.title: Would stay at the Omni Again
Nice, Warm, Clean Place to Stay
reviews.text: They offer free Starbucks coffee all day, which is especially nice if you have travelled and are now in a different time zone. The staff at the Grand Cafe was very friendly and accommodating.
The room was cleaned early in the day, which is somehting that I just haven't seen happen in most other hotels.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
A good find and two new fans of downtown LA.
reviews.text: We requested early check-in for two rooms and, although they weren't ready when we arrived, they were available to us within the hour.

Upscale hotel in the middle of downtown on Bunker Hill. Close to many things and DASH bus is only 25c (10c if you’re 65) for jaunts around town. Hotel offers town car service for trips within a 3-mile radius. DASH took me to Union Station for 10c; cab back at 9 pm cost $8. Cheerful Concierge helped me extend parking from $5 for 2 hours to $5 for all evening so friends could meet me for dinner at Noe Restaurant. Chambermaid always had a sunny smile. I was very happy to stay at the Omni.
reviews.title: Upscale Hotel in Bunker Hill Financial Area

reviews.text: The Omni is primarily a business hotel given that it is adjacent to many banks and office buildings; but my husband and I spent a lovely weekend there during a hobby convention. The service was top-notch and because we joined their loyalty program, every morning complimentary coffee and orange juice were delivered to our door.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in the heart of downtown Los Angeles

reviews.text: Everyone on the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel restaurant is pricey, as we expected, but there are several more reasonable options nearby.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: The Omni is next to Angel's Flight and in walking distance of the Music Center, Museum of Contemporary Art, and the LA Subway.
reviews.title: would definitely stay again
Poor experience - Noise problems though management eventually responded
reviews.text: Stayed here for a few days while our daughter was touring USC. This lovely hotel met and exceeded our expectations. The staff, without exception, was helpful and warm; the room was large, clean and stylish and the free car service came in very handy! Easy access to the freeways and especially to USC. Hotel parking was a bit pricey but the service timely and accommodating. I'd recommend joining Omni's frequent traveler club, the amenities are a great value.

Stayed for two nights in January while on a business trip. As succinctly as possible, it's a great location in downtown LA and a beautiful hotel. The rooms are nicely appointed, large, and featured very comfortable beds. The fitness center was a decent size and had most of the amenities required for a good workout away from home. I appreciated that Omni Select Guests get free internet. My one gripe is that I stayed in an adjoining room and the door musn't be sound proof because I found the noise level to be ridiculous for a hotel of this caliber. I heard every conversation and bodily function from my neighbors and there's really no excuse for that. My recommendation would be to stay in a non-adjoining room, if you have the option, to ensure you have a pleasant night's sleep.
reviews.title: Good but rooms are not soundproof

reviews.text: We spent only one night here in March...took the train up from San Diego to see a concert (Keith Jarett, jazz pianist) at the Walt Disney. I would have liked to have stayed longer...
reviews.title: Great if you're attending a concert at Walt Disney of the Music Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were great--from doorman to reception to room service to housekeeping (I managed to break a glass, and they came right away and vacuumed and replaced the glass).
reviews.title: Lovely hotel ,Such helpful staff, delightful resturant and amazing music.

reviews.text: Our room was on the 6th floor with a bit of a view (two high-rise condo buildings across the street blocked most of the view). The room was large, with two double beds, a comfortable wing chair, a desk with desk chair and a bureau containing mini-bar, drawers, coffee service, ice bucket and glassware. Atop the bureau was a 48" (?) Panasonic TV. The furniture was walnut. The beds were fitted with thick mattresses with pill-top and wonderfully soft linens and duvet. Very comfy. The decor was pleasing--muted tans and off-whites. Nice art work on the walls. Temperature could be controlled by thermostat.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, so-so location

reviews.text: The bath was spacious; it had a glass-enclosed, nicely tiled shower as well as a separate bath tub. The vanity was contemporary in style with marble top, etc. The bath amenities were high quality. Plenty of plush towels too.
reviews.title: Fantastic property, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in the Omni LA, it was a great experience, staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was amazing and the room was comfortable - loved the bed!!!
reviews.title: Great hotel - not so great location for turism!

reviews.text: The only negative aspect was the location, if you are looking for a holiday it is really far away from all the LA attractions (apart from museums and concert hall). Won't come back due the location, but would recommend it for business trips to everyone!!
reviews.title: Another Great Stay at the Omni

likes.liked: — Friendly helpful staff, and cleaniless of rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Omni for one night, as part of our trip to San Diego. LA was a good stop over point for us and allowed us to see The American Girl Store in The Grove--about 20 minutes away.
reviews.title: Fab hotel

likes.liked: — It was spotlessly clean - the bed was fabulous, big, comfortable and completely white

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had stayed at this hotel a few years ago, and liked it then so we rebooked here without a second thought.
reviews.title: Great Experience
Great Hotel / Resturant is Overpriced
reviews.text: Once again, we enjoyed our one night stay here. The staff are very friendly and helpful and make you feel very welcomed. The kids received a welcome goodie bag upon arrival.

aka: Omni Los Angeles At California Plaza Hotel
